description: The food was good but the spinach was frozen and the prices super high. After all we stopped in for breakfast and after 30.00 for two one would think I ordered breakfast. Its was ok but not worth the price paid
author: Laurie I.

description: I liked what they had but they didn't have any small brioche!! I ended up getting a croissant but would have liked it to be heated a bit. Overall I will go back but hope they address some of the comments.
author: Yasmin M.

description: panini is good...french toast is perfect....avocado with egg omelet somethin's missing maybe a hint of mint :)
author: Nelson O.

description: I love this little restaurant. Friendly staff and yummy food. My company loves the beet salad, grilled chicken panini, and the granola parfait.
author: Amy C.

description:
Oh Brioche. Brioche, Brioche, Brioche. I want to like you. You with your Parisian ways and your fresh bread and your fancy shmancy sandwiches. But the truth is, every time I order one of your fancy sandwiches, soups, or pastries, I'm left slightly disappointed (and a whole lot poorer).

Your roast beef sandwich lacks flavor. Your pastries are always slightly stale. And your soup is a little too liquidy. Am I being too picky? Probably. But when I'm paying approximately $15 for a lunch consisting of a take-out soup and sandwich, I guess I'm crazy enough to expect near perfection.

Take your three layer mousse cake. Dark chocolate, milk chocolate, white chocolate, topped with a little chocolate cigar. Seems simple enough. Except there's a weird spongy layer in between. And the chocolate mousse feels so light, it has almost no flavor. And the entire concoction feels like it's been sitting in your refrigerated display case for too long. Same with your hazelnut tart. And your chocolate chip cookie.

The only saving grace is your chocolate croissant which is downright perfect. So perfect that you happen to run out every afternoon. Guess everyone else around me is also in on the secret of your perfect chocolate croissant. So yes, I will keep on coming to your expensive, frou frou little shop. But I'm only getting the chocolate croissant!
author: Nadeem A.

description: Nice little cafe spot with delicious and well decorated pastries. A lil pricey, but worthwhile. the portion is pretty huge and not overly sweet.  Staffs are polite and friendly. A perfect spot to take a break if you're touring the city. Not too packed on a weekday afternoon. Would definitely visit again.
author: Xe C.

description:
Just the best damn croissant I've ever had in San Francisco, no big deal. 

Seriously, go here before 11am and order your self a croissant.  Ask them to heat it a little for you and experience what a real croissant taste like.  The other pastry is legit as are the egg plates for brunch and the sandwiches.  Very well done when it comes to getting french and north african cuisine right.  The owner is also the sweetest woman and absolutely rocks with passionate about her food and business.  I come here a few times per week to start my day right.
author: Mia F.

description: Macaron review! And thats all im reviewing. Chewy, dense, good but not like the airy light and slightly chewy macarons im looking for. The gals were nice and the macarons were good but not amazing.
author: Tina N.

description: It's a nice place with friendly staff (a bit cramped) but the eggs Benedict was nothing special.
author: John H.

description: One of my favorite lunch spots in my neighborhood. Have to be careful with the praises, because it's already too popular for its own good. Love their salade nicoise, chicken pot pie, sandwiches. The kitchen is not always consistent, e.g., skimping on veggies or chicken in their pot pies, too much nutmeg in lasagna, and my main complaint, the overly sweet balsamic dressing they tend to put on every salad. Overall, though, love this little cafe.
author: Firat Y.

description:
I spent my first few months in SF living a couple blocks from this place, and I came here for breakfast at least twice a week during that time. 

The avocado scramble is my favorite thing on the menu, along with the baguette sandwiches (I love both the prosciutto and turkey). I like that the sandwiches also come with a side salad. I don't like sweets much but the almond croissants are delicious. The coffee is just fine and very strong!

This place gets 5 stars for both the yummy food and the atmosphere. I always feel super comfortable here whether I'm with friends or by myself; the staff is really friendly and I love sitting outside and taking in the sights on Columbus. 

Even though I've moved out of the neighborhood I'm definitely planning to come back soon!
author: Lisa A.

description: I have been coming here for more than 4 month for lunch and the service you get here is probably one of the most pleasant I have received. They always seem very welcoming and the food is always perfect. It is my favorite spot for good lunch. Thank you staff of brioche cafe!
author: Eddie S.

description:
Rho*:  Hey there Carb whatcha doin there not in my tummy?
Carb: Oh hey Rho* I'm all yours baby.  Thought you left me for the meatheads.
Rho*: You are, and always will be, the folds in my tummy, the jiggle in my thighs, the plump in my cheeks.
Carb: Top or bottom?
Rho*: Both, darling.  Both.  
Carb:  *dough rises*
Rho*: swooooooon.  You know I'll always knead you.
Carb:  You do give good bread.

Carb and I have been together for a long time.  Carb and I have an open relationship.  Yes, this means you can have yourself some Carb as well.  I will not be Jelly.  Because Jelly is her own person.  Actually, Jelly is great w/Carb too.  We're all a big happy polyamorous bunch.  

Today Carb went to Brioche Bakery and spoiled me by playing dress up:

-Almond Croissant filled w/almond paste, baked, dipped in rum, then baked again
-Cheddar and Garlic Loaf
-Cheesey buttery toast


Just as expected, Carb did not disappoint.  Always leaves me wanting more. 

I loaf you, Carb.
author: Rho T.

description:
300th review!!!

One of things I like about working in the FiDi is how close it is to North Beach!

Brioche Bakery & Cafe has become one of my go-to spots for lunch. They offer pastries, quiche, sandwiches, paninis, and salads in a cute, cozy, friendly and welcoming environment.

They have a pretty solid menu filled with different salads, paninis, and sandwiches. My favorite of their paninis is the turkey panini with chipotle spread and jack cheese. There is so much flavor in the chipotle spread and it's easy to see why it has become one of my favorites. The turkey, jack cheese, and chipotle spread easily compliment each other. All paninis come with a mixed green salad, that is extremely fresh. I have also tried their quiche, which is so delicious! It's really creamy and all the vegetables they use are fresh. Definitely another favorite to order there. 

Service is great - the staff at Brioche are so kind and friendly! 

It's a small cafe, so grab a spot if you see a table. Sit outside if it's a nice day and you are into people watching.

Whether you are looking to escape the FiDi or are spending the day in North Beach, you must try Brioche Bakery & Cafe - you won't be disappointed!
author: Stephanie C.

description: Meh, just meh. Maybe it was my fault for going straight for the Benedict's instead of trying their macarons/pastries but with so many great choices for brunch in SF they really were nothing special. The hollandaise was ok but nothing great. Eggs were overcooked and so were potatoes. Will come back to try pastries
author: Sara C.

description: I loved the avocado scramble here! It could use a little extra flavor, but it a great brunch to enjoy outside on the patio, on a gorgeous and balmy San Francisco day. The fresh squeezed orange juice was delicious. It took just a little long for us to get our food, and I ended up being double charged (which I think my credit card caught and resolved without me having to do anything - yay Capital One!), so I can't give it 5 stars. But this is a delightful little spot to enjoy a cup of coffee, pastry, or light brunch.
author: Vanessa H.

description: Nice spot to grab some real breakfast food: eggs, greens, toasts, coffee, all made fresh and delicious...
author: Michele D.

description:
Awesome french toast and eggs benedict and awesome service. My favorite place in this San Fran road trip! 

Place was small but cozy...it was Labor Day Monday so it was quiet... No complaints here! Lol!
author: Amy C.

description: Great breakfast and would come here gain. Eggs Benedict were light and very tasty. French toast was not to sweet just right
author: Neal E.

description: Niçoise salad was very good. Beautiful location. 4 stars because they the water is self serve and they ran out while I was there... so I was thirsty. They have wifi though which is more important
author: Daniel P.

description: Good lunch spot in North Beach! Panini, pastries, quiche, salads, cookies, etc. Quality food and service. Very Parisian ambiance. Sandwiches are about $8.50-9.00, but that's pretty standard (if not cheap!) for San Francisco.
author: Hillary D.

description:
Charming little French bakery. Reasonably priced fare with very nice presentation.

I had the french toast which tasted good though not the usual way (it's dipped in vanilla custard). It had a lot of berries and sugar.

The owner (I presume) was really nice and attentive. 

I'd come back for morning breakfast or brunch.
author: Victor W.

description: Delicious breakfast!  Loved everything we ordered.  The spinach/Gruyere omelet was perfectly cooked: fluffy and light.  Brioch French toast with fresh berries was also excellent.  Their iced teas were infused with mint(?) which was so refreshing.  It was a great meal.
author: E C.

description: Quiche was good, eggs benny was meh, lattes were amazing, almond croissant was bomb, they had the door open it was also cold.  Also for 3 to eat bfast one being a kid 45 with tip, kinda spendy
author: Rick F.

description: Apple crumble was amazing we were lucky to get the last one! Breakfast croissant was warm, flaky and delicious. Great spot, very cozy and cute!
author: Diana B.

description:
Continuing on my hunt for the tastiest almond croissant I found myself at the cross street of the Lunar New Year parade and Brioche Bakery and Cafe. 

Almond croissant here has: 
* Toasted and nutty almonds on top
* Flaky, buttery and tender insides 
* Just sweet enough almond paste filling

Also tried a blueberry-raspberry-strawberry juice (still not entirely sure what mixture of berries was in there) and MAN that was tangy and dericious. If I come back I'm going after that buttery brioche and a cup of coffee!

If you're a pastry fan in any capacity make the trip out here! It's worth it and you will NOT regret it!!!
author: Kelly E.

description:
Making my rounds to all the sweets and bakery shops in the area during my first visit to North Beach, I stopped by Brioche and left with an almond croissant, and plain brioche, to take home to my toaster (I toast everything - it makes even a mediocre pastry just that much better).

Unfortunately, from what I can recall, neither pastry was particularly impressive or memorable. Not bad, certainly, but, assuming you don't mind the wait, you're better off going to Tartine - this, is one of the good parts of Brioche, since there wasn't a single person ahead of me in line that day.

Now, granted, I dropped by sometime in the afternoon, so their tastier pastries may have been sold out by then, or might have just plain been tastier when fresher, so, take this with a grain of salt.
author: Johnny W.

description: It is ok if you need a small meal. Compared to real French Brioche, Quiche, ... There is a lot room for improvement. The almond croissant is quite good, but I did not like the coffee and the quiche was ok.
author: Kay H.

description:
Brioche Bakery and Cafe is one of those wonderfully tucked away gems that makes you want to visit on a daily basis, sit and relax as you enjoy a homemade chocolate croissant, a pecan pie tart, and a satisfying cup of coffee. 

As frequent visitors to San Francisco, this is one of those places that we like to return to and enjoy. The owners and staff are lovely, too.
author: Mrl C.

description: I came here and ordered the Poached Pear Salad to go and as soon as I was done placing my order the guy whipped it out prepackaged. The salad itself was very scarce which wasn't what I expected for paying $9. I've been to other places and for the same price I got salads that are twice the size and it included actual protein (eggs, chicken, bacon...etc). Although the pears does give the greens an extra oomph, the overall salad was lacking in volume. If I was ever in the area again I'll give something else a try, but will definitely skip the salad next time.
author: Renee Y.

description:
I'm here at Brioche now! This is actually my second time eating here today (I've had lunch and breakfast) and my third time this weekend.

The owner is extremely accommodating, welcoming and hospitable. The food is yummy and the service is very good. When they've greeted, served and bid me farewell, I feel like they are genuinely happy to have my business. In addition, eating here is comforting and makes me feel truly part of the community here. 

Hope this is helpful!
author: Becky A.

description: Delicious breakfast sandwiches and quiche!! The spinach quiche was truly delightful. Friendly staff and authentic French atmosphere.
author: Zoë L.

description: Cute restaurant. The French onion was yummy. The pastries look amazing. The staff is very nice. There are a few tables inside and outside.
author: Lynne Marie Raguindin B.

description: Oh my! I have been here twice and got different things each visit. Both times I was impressed by the flavor of the food here. I got a salami sandwich on french bread, which was toasted and orange juice it was extremely delicious!  My wife had a croissant sandwich that was also super yummy.  The second time I tried their french toast and hot chocolate. The hot chocolate is strong but not overpowering and very foamy, the French toasts were so good that they didn't even need syrup.  Hands down my favorite place to have breakfast in San Francisco!
author: Matias S.

description: Best Ham & Cheese croissant I have ever had... including better than some I had in Europe. Really good tiramisu and damn good sandwiches. If you want quality for a great price, go here. You will not be disappointed.
author: Sarah M.

description:
Most things are more expensive in San Francisco; toilet paper and toilet seat cover is not one of them.  In general, if the bathroom of a restaurant is super disgusting, I don't like to eat what the cooks cook in that restaurant for guess where they go to the bathroom and wash their hands? In that same disgusting bathroom. 

My boyfriend had a latte, and I tasted it. It was ok. Nothing to write home about. Nothing to want to go back to have more of.
author: Moozhan T.

description:
Took a late break the other from a meeting and stopped by Brioche.

It's a small little cafe, with 7 tables inside and 3-4 tables outside.

Super friendly service and very clean inside.

I ordered the much-talked about almond croissant and a single latte.

The croissant was super flaky with a generous moist filling inside. 
The latte was richly prepared.

Great place for city watching (people, pets, cars, and an occasional transit bus that literally stops in front of Brioche)

Btw...they play Italian love songs inside, at least when I visited.

Nice find...cheers!
author: Derek N.

description: The food is outstanding! I always order the quiche...different kinds as well as tiramisu. The staff are nice as well. Even the iced tea is good...has a mint flavor. I try and get there every couple of weeks. The prices are fair as well.
author: Linda B.

description: We went here for breakfast on a Thursday, wasn't crowded at all. I went with the quiche after reading other yelp reviews, really glad I did. It was really good, it's thicker than a usually quiche and the crust was thin but good. My boyfriend got the French breakfast with pieces of French bread, butter, jam and fruits. The bread was really good with a great crust. Would visit again if I lived in the area.
author: Chi L.

description: Really nice place to sit down and relax before a very busy morning. It's a highly recommended little cafe to get a nice cup of coffee for a person with a "college student expenses"
author: Brian B.

description: Ok I'm giving only two stars Bc I got really upset, I ordered eggs Benedict and they where boiled eggs literally. The thing I love the most is a nice runny yolk and my eggs where completely hard. It came with potatoes (not great) and fruit (nice and fresh) Coffee was good. No need to come back to this place - Nice location though !
author: Adriana V.

description: I was really excited to check off one of my bookmarked bakeries. This place is very cute, but tiny. The customer service was great, greeted me as soon as I walked in the door and they're very friendly. I ordered their hot panini sandwiches, grilled turkey and grilled chicken. I just wasn't impressed, it was good but not worth ordering lunch here again. Maybe I'll  return again and try their pastries because that's what they're known for... But then again I wasn't tempted to try one by what was displayed in the window.
author: Stacey K.

description:
Stopped by today to cash in my gilt city deal $9 for a cold sandwich, green salad, soda, and cookie.  Was not impressed enough to go back for the same meal paying 40% more.

It does look like I missed the goodies - will plan on going back to grab an almond croissant and coffee next time.

I will say the oatmeal raisin cookie was superb, regular sized cookie for $1.75 though. OUCH?
author: Melody T.

description: Ordered the herb scramble and the avacado scramble. Food tasted alright but the portions were small for the price. There are many other better options in north beach and the city.
author: Akshai B.

description:
Chocolate croissaint review only...

In Paris last year for a few days I had a fresh pastry every day for breakfast. This chocolate croissant not only reminded me of the parisan delicasies - but are even better than those I remembered. 

Haven't tried anything else - and probably won't unless they run out of the croissant!
author: Sean S.

description:
This is a super cute pastry cafe that I discovered thanks to Gilt City certificates for a delightful Sunday morning brunch with the bf. The selection was only ok because we got there a bit later in the brunch period so they were sold out of a lot of their yummier pastries.

They breads were almost completely gone but I ended up getting some fig bread and it was delightful. They don't really cut it for you but I just inquired if they did and the owner (or I assumed it was the owner...) did it for me anyway! It was very sweet of her. They have pretty good coffee in this small cafe and on a sunny day it looks warm and inviting!

This is cute spot for brunch or lunch and I'd highly recommend their sandwiches and breakfast specials because they were pretty delicious!
author: Lorrie M.

description: #Brioche is a pretty nice French bakery, ideal to fill your tank before embarking on a walking trip of the un- even hills of San Francisco, San Andreas Fault to be blamed. Good and friendly service is provided, courtesy of the South-of-the-Border amigos. Freshly squeezed orange juice, a small cappuccino, and some damn good eggs benedict with Canadian bacon, lemon Hollandaise sauce & roasted rosemary potatoes did the trick.  Several visits afterwards (it was during the 2014 Soccer World Cup season, pre-filling stage before the 09:00am games -in the pub- was a must) standards were met and kept at the same level and had the chance to taste the Grilled Caprese hot panino with fresh mozzarella, marinated roma tomatoes plus freshly made basil pesto, tasty and succulent indeed as well as the Prosciutto cold sandwich (Parma ham, tomatoes & brie in a French baguette) that helped to fill the void too. Brioche has sit-in tables as well as take out/take away service that caters for the Financial District offices' staff. After 10am might get pretty busy and bustling, with all tables taken by customers connected to its strong Wi-Fi network and a queue for its take away service, this reassures you the freshness of its products. Great place to go back to!
author: Pablo D.

description:
When in Northbeach do as the Northbeachans do-- go and get your morning brioche! Light and airy, served warm, smear buttah and jelly with a nice cup of coffee and you're off to a good start on your day... Come back later in the afternoon, if you're lucky-- repeat.
PS- They're usually gone by late afternoon
author: Arissa C.

description: Brunch is good but meal portions are not as big as what you expect in normal dinners!!
author: Sabah N.

description:
cute little spot in between north beach and the fidi. came here to kill some time while waiting for glamour closet to call me back. 

seats are available inside and out, which is splendid. the desert choices were a bit overwhelming. I got the blueberry tart and wow, it was pretty delish! I just wished they didn't glaze the blueberries with so much corn syrup. the French macarons were ehhhh.
author: Ann T.

description: Very good and fast service on a Saturday/ Brunch for two $40 two main plates, two cappuccinos and two freshly squeezed orange juice.
author: David S.

description: Great breakfast. I had the eggs Benedict and the hollandaise sauce was incredible. Great place to have breakfast.
author: FoodLover G.

description:
It was 6:30 am on a Sunday. My phone was dying and I needed a coffee. This place was open and had welcoming feeling. The coffee is tasty. This day had french roast, mocha, and decaf. I secured an outlet next to the chips rack with a view of morning commute on Columbus st. Ahh life is okay right?
I grabbed a yogurt parfait which is strange because yogurt is not my cup of tea. It wasn't half bad though, the honey mixed well with strawberries, orange, granola, and yogurt. Overall I was comfortable typing away on a fully charged phone.
author: Dave Z.

description: Best croissant sandwich I've ever had, although a bit much, two could probably share. Locations not best (right outside is the bus stop) and cappuccino is sub-par, but decent prices and very friendly, helpful staff!! Also very yummy looking bakery treats!
author: Marge W.

description: I used Brioche Bakery to cater an event and everyone was blown away with how delicious the food tasted. Not only was it good, but they were wonderful to work with and incredibly knowledgable with helping me customize my order. I will definitely use them again for another event!
author: Darby B.

description: We ordered the 2 chocolate mousse and 1 opera cake, plus an Americano, Mocha, & 3 hot chocolates: they were all divine!!! We were visiting San Francisco and we're lucky enough to fall into this little bakery, which we almost couldn't find. And we strike it rich in chocolate. Next time we return, I will come here daily!!!
author: Stacy L.

description:
Love this place - everything I've tried from the lamb to mac n' cheese, salads and baked goods. The best part: they have wi-fi! 

I did suggest that they try a different blend for capucinnos and lattes.
author: Jessica V.

description: This place is so nice and has wonderful staff. The French toast  was very good and I love the vibe that the place has. Overall would recommend to anyone looking for a nice quiet breakfast.
author: Itzel R.

description: Love this place. We came here twice in our three days in SF. Wonderful fresh food. We had a Croquet Monsieur, Spinach & Gruyere Omelet, Avocado Scramble and one of their Almond Croissants, it was all wonderful, coffee was great and a lovely relaxing place. I will try their Eggs Benedict next time I'm in town.
author: Noel D.

description: Absolutly to die for. I break my fast here almost every morning and I never tire of the joint. Thanks cafe brioche for the best French toast ever!!
author: Erik H.

description: Nothing like a croissant and coffee in a cute little sidewalk cafe.  Easy walk from our hotel. Stayed a while longer just for the ambiance.
author: Micaela S.

description: This homie cafe is the way to go. Ordered the avocado scrambled egg special and it was so good. Service is great. Portions are good!
author: Therese T.

description:
This was my first time to Brioche.
I ordered grilled veggie sandwich for takeout. It was a huge sandwich was not cut in half which made it extremely difficult to handle. It was also very soggy because of way too much of pesto on the slices of bread.
I think this was my worst sandwich experience ever!
author: Nidhi G.

description: Great little bakery.  We had avocado scramble and also freshly baked breakfast croissant sandwich.  Great presentation with the nicely sliced avacado.  Friendly service and delicious coffee.
author: John M.

description: Very friendly. Nice cozy place. Made accommodations to make sure my little picky eater gets what he likes
author: Kevin V.

description: This place sucks. San Fran has so many great places to eat. Don't bother with this one.
author: Jessica P.

description: Really delicious food, I had avocado scramble and the eggs were perfect. They seemed to be whipped up with cream and they were fluffy and delicious. My boyfriend had the brioche french toast and really enjoyed that too. Iced tea was surprisingly good too and the space is quaint and personal.
author: Kelli G.

description: The french pastries are absolutely amazing. I have been to Paris several times and they are spot on. Try the brioche French toast or the pan au chocolate. You won't be disappointed...
author: Jed T.

description: i was expecting more from the french toast. its a seat yourself, go up front type place to order, so price point matched the restaurant culture. breakfast sandwich was good, i chided myself for not ordering it. if you want coffee though, go next door!
author: Jan Y.

description:
Total fail.

The good and the bad:
Good:
- They serve food (if you don't mind getting it uncooked or luke-warm)
- Latte was pretty good
- Convenient location

Bad (where do I start):
- Let me start by saying we dined at a time when they were not busy, no line and only half their tables were being used...so, no excuse for them there
- First meal came about 20 minutes after ordering (after others who had ordered after us had received their food)
- One meal was served luke-warm (Avocado scramble) served with cold toast
- Only one meal was served to start with...the other took about another 20 mins
- Once the second meal arrived (Eggs Benedict), I, eager to eat, cut  into the eggs Benedict only to find the eggs watery and raw. Immediately all the whites ran over the plate and dissolved...nasty
- Unfortunately, we had an event to attend and had to leave. So, I returned my meal and asked for my money back
- To add insult to injury (or hunger, in this case) the lady running the restaurant returned exactly the amount of my meal. I guess she decided they deserved to keep the tax, for all their hard work
author: Mark B.

description:
If I came here in the morning would the things I ordered tasted differently? Maybe cuz they would be freshly made...? I dunno...

I came into Brioche because of the good reviews but I was seriously underwhelmed. The prosciutto sandwich came in a french bread that had the texture of cardboard on the outside and tissue paper on the inside. The prosciutto was very salty and only slightly offset by the bitterness of the arugula. Mehh... I only finished half my sandwich before I couldn't stomach any more. 

Almond tarte was good. It was moist and wasn't too sweet. The small latte was also good. Not great but it tasted good with the almond tarte. So I had the sandwich, tarte and small latte for a little over $16. Definitely not worth that much...
author: Don D.

description:
I chanced upon the place while walking on Columbus. I was famished after the gym and was excited about the tantalizing array of possibilities that lined the street. Brioche Cafe was amongst the first place that I saw and the charming Parisian atmosphere drew me through its doors. 

The cafe is named after the delectable pastry and the place offered several varieties of brioche. I was in the mood for something savory for dinner and the clerk recommended the Niçoise sandwich. I also ordered a chocolate chip cookie. I mean, how can one walk out sans any sweets from a bakery? I was told that they make everything in-house in a nearby baking facility.

I was in a hurry so I got the food to-go and chomped on the sandwich as I walked. It felt oddly appropriate that I was gnawing on a phallic sandwich as I passed strip club after strip club. The sandwich was delicious and did not leave me with any regrets for being so decisive and ordering from the first place I saw. The tuna wasn't fishy and as you take more bites and get to the olives and celery bits, it really enhanced the flavor of the sandwich. The chocolate chip cookie was very thin (I wish my cookies spread like that) and crunchy on the outside, but chewy (but still firm in texture) toward the center. It wasn't loaded with massive chunks of chocolate (which I liked) and it's one of the better cookies that I've tried.

I don't know how a gem like this escaped my radar for so long! There were so many tempting options on display (including two varieties of pastilla). I can't wait to go back and try more items. Maybe grab brunch these on a weekend.
author: Alice W.

description: I don't know if it's because it was close to closing time, but their macaroons were not crunchy at all -- they were very soft and didn't melt in your mouth. I've had day-old macaroons from other places that were better. Good flavors but not properly executed. I was disappointed.
author: M C.

description:
I love this place for their sandwiches. I came here twice. The first time I got the chicken sandwich and fell in LOVE. It was amazing. I waited about 15 minutes for it to be made but it was worth every second.

The next time I got the tuna melt---omg! Heaven!!!! I shared it with a friend and it is now our favorite place to get a sandwich/ tuna melt. I wish I lived in that neighborhood still!
author: Cesie A.

description:
I was sad that the pastries were all gone when I came here around lunch time...

So instead I tried some of their tiramisu which was really good! It was extremely moist, and each time I sunk my spoon into the cake, coffee drizzled out onto the plate. It also had flecks of chocolate and nuts in the mousse. 

My friends also tried the chicken salad and the prosciutto/pear/avocado sandwich and loved it!
author: Jeanette S.

description: One of the best bakeries in SF in my opinion. The desserts are to die for and the service is excellent.
author: Steven E.

description: Went there because of the "check-in coupon" of a free coffee, but they refused to provide it to me, claiming that is isn't valid since last March  (9 months ago).
author: Alon S.

description:
Great great great! 

Brioche is a French bakery that always has unique sandwiches, excellent bread (ever had the brioche?), coffee drinks, and a refreshing strawberry lemonade! 

Everything is simply different from what you find elsewhere. For instance, taste the merguez (spicy lamb panini) or try the quiche. Pay attention to the sweet hints of honey in their salad dressing. You'll be impressed. 

The owners are often there, and their friendliness trickles down throughout their staff. They keep a current exhibition of local art on their walls, so you can always see some great photography or paintings while enjoying your meal. 

Free Wifi. 
Great food. 
Good smiles. 
Happy stomach. 
I only wish it was open later.
author: David D.

description: For a bakery, they certainly don't stock many baked goods. I've visited here twice around midday in the past month, and both times they were missing croissants, cakes, and all the other delicious stuff that's been posted here. Just some twisty cinnamon bread and a few pie tarts -- which I'm sure are tasty, but why not have a little more available? I want to give you money if you'll let me!
author: Joshua M.

description:
The four of us(wife,two kids, & I) went here to Brioche Bakery in the morning, because most of the coffee shops in North Beach are crowded esp.on the weekends. 

This small and cozy bakery carries a good assorted variety of pastries,and bread. Their Equator-brand coffee,which i ordered, was very tasty and an instant eye-opener. The Caffe Latte, which my wife ordered, was smooth and perfectted very well. My daughter drank hot-chocalate and son drank OJ; they enjoyed it and gotten no negative feedbacks on their respected drinks.

My son and I spitted a Fresh Vegeterian Panini sandwich. Yes,me eating Vegeterian Pannini,ladies and gentlemen Yelp-members. It was a good sandwich,which contains lettuce, tomatoes, onion, pickles,cucumbers and avocadoes on a toasted sourdough bread,made fresh on the spot, and costs $5.00. My son loves vegetables and enjoyed his share of the delicious sandwich with me.

My wife and daughter ordered the fresh pastries. My wife bought the almond croissant and daughter bought a blueberry muffin at $1.75 each. Like mother,like daughter, they enjoyed their own pastries and meant business when whoofing down the pastries. The blueberry muffin had crusty sugar top, and the almond Croissant was flaky and filled with thick almond-fillings;and other delicious pastries looks to be in my future consideration for storage in my DeWalt toolbox.

This bakery is a five star with good pastries and coffee, but minus one-star,because they are closed on Sundays.
author: Matt G.

description: Came here for breakfast each day of our weekend away. The beautifully softly scrambled eggs and avocado were nice. As was the spinach and Gruyere omelet and  the yogurt and granola. Good cappuccino and lattes. The sweet brioche was a nice sweet treat. Highly recommended.
author: Julie K.

description:
great desserts, tasty mocha

went for gelato though, was told they didnt have any...felt misled
author: Long C.

description:
- Great natural light all around. 
- The pastry selection seemed nice- has a bakery feel to it. 
- hopefully, it won't become chain-y like Starbucks, now that they bought them. 
- nice wooden tables and plenty of seating. 
- not too crowded so perhaps not the best people watching place.
author: Taz H.

description:
This cafe is tucked a little bit away off busy Little Italy, but in front of the busy Columbus traffic. Wouldn't think this cafe is that great if I didn't accidentally stumble across it on Yelp. 

All the bread and pastries look fabulous, but I was aiming for the almond croissant. OMG, absolutely the best almond croissant I've ever had in my life. This beats all the croissants I had in France hands down.
author: Novalina N.

description: Love this place. Fresh fruit and beautiful outdoor seating, takes me back to when I went to Amsterdam. Great for people watching. Nice people and great service. Coffee isn't bad either. Highly recommend :)
author: Alexis G.

description: Tasty bakery with very good coffee. I had one of the best coffees in the city here. The cakes etc. also very tasty. Beautiful place to take a break.
author: Andreas M.

description:
Food here, overall, is, at least, four stars.  There are some small exceptions - got a French Onion soup to-go today and say what? Couldn't find the cheese. Once had an omelette that was pretty bland but the sandwiches are delish and the soups are generally wonderful. 

I love the man who seems like he owns this establishment, he exudes European charm and courtesy but some of the pretty little girls who work here seem clueless about customer service. 

I once stood behind the only other customer in the cafe for what seemed like an eternity (More than 3 minutes!) while he, an insufferable boasting, hipster type, flirted with the little lady behind the counter, chatting about burning man, his latest start-up, what concert she last attended and other shit totally NOT germane to my to-go lunch order.  What is that thing everyone said seven years ago? I think I threw-up a little bit in my mouth.
author: Laura M.

description: Came in at maybe 730 am on a Friday, so no wait time. Plain croissant was buttery deliciousness and almond croissant was all kinds of wonderful - it even had a surprise almondy middle. Coffee was great and that's coming from a Seattleite.
author: Summer F.

description: BEST quiche I've ever had! It was the mushroom quiche that can only be described as buttery doughy heaven that melted in your mouth. Great ambiance!
author: Ana Cristina J.

description: This place rocks. Walked in here one day to grab some coffee and walked out with a fruit parfait (for later) and a delicious breakfast croissant. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful, which is great because I  accidentally (luckily) left my umbrella there and had to pick it up on my way home from work. Picked up a chicken pot pie and LOVED it. So glad I found this place, I'll be back tomorrow morning to enjoy a latte and savor a scrumptious pastry.
author: Heather R.

description:
The extra-peppy French music is a little much for eat-in, espc. 1st thing in the morning. Also the cramped environs where you have to constantly watch you're not whacking something with an elbow. Pretty good for a decent (San Francisco Coffee Co.) to-go coffee in a pinch for 2 bucks, though. Pastries are probably good since they've been at this location forever, hell if I'm paying that much for them.

Food is way too expensive and place is slammed up with irritating yuppies doing their precious bistro/"people watching" thing around lunchtime and all day weekends, so who knows about the food quality. Not me.
author: Jeremy H.

description:
This place is right around the corner of my work place and I feel uncomfortable walking into the office without my caffeine in hand so I'm here a lot. 

First things first, this place is over priced.  $5 for OJ. $5 for a piece of brownie. Are they worth $5? No. Don't even get me started on the yogurt parfait. 

Second, I find their espresso drinks to be inconsistent. Some days its good, some days it tastes too watery. Coffee is pretty decent though. 

Third, their customer service...while I think all the people there are really friendly, there is one girl that I don't particularly have a great impression of because shes rung me up for the wrong prices a few times. =.="

However, solid three stars because 
1. Great Wifi
2. SUGAR BRIOCHE OMG SO GOOD! WHERE HAVE YOU BEEN MY WHOLE EXISTENCE? 
3. Cute place =) 
4. Some of their muffins and pastries are decent.
author: Cindy L.

description:
(See pics)

I am still recovering from each bite of the food.

Thanks to Manabu M's review of this place, my colleague and I came here to pick up something to indulge.

As soon as we walked in we were pulled into the aroma that just opened up our appetite. They have a good number kinds of brioche everything, tarts, bread, etc. There were no description tags so I just patiently asked every kind they offer.

I got my grilled cheese and ham. Bread was a bit dry and I am guessing it's because they tried to do mine and my colleague's at the same time first, then realized it's too small of a grill to do both and had to redo one at a time. It's still quite brioche tasty.

I also got the chocolate mousse that they instructed me to put in the microwave to heat it up, which my colleague candidly and playfully joked it's got the aluminum container that I should not try it at work (there was a recent microwave that over-popped some popcorn at work.) I put it in the oven at home and the chocolate melted like waterfall in slow motion, sending me to some height happiness on my tongue, especially with the top was still crusty. Divine.

I also picked up brioche original and another one with walnut that I can continue my savoring for the next couple days.
author: T L.

description:
I used to think that brioche just meant a sweet pastry, but Brioche Bakery taught me that it is this round and soft bun, warm and fresh early in the morning.  

I really wanted to like it, but as a student and I sat and dissected our breakfast we found it to be just a tad too dry for our liking.  

Still, it always smells so good that I'm sure I'll try again.
author: Linda T.

description: Almond croissant is crisp yet gooey inside. The breakfast looks amazing. Cute French decor inside! The pastries look delish!
author: Joleen Q.

description: Amazing place. We had a brunch there- one of the best veggie sandwiches I've ever had. Great service, lady behind the register and everyone else was very friendly. I got walnut bread to go which we ate in our car on the way back home to LA.
author: Stewie A.

description:
I walk by this place every day on the way to work and their pastries are the most tempting thing in the universe. So tell me why on the one day we decide to come here, I don't get a pasty? Don't have a clue. Considering the fact that a woman ordered SIX almond croissants while we were brunching (yes, six), I think that might be the thing to get...

Ordered the open-faced smoked salmon sandwich and brioche french toast. The smoked salmon sando (SSS for short) was definitely the better of the two in my opinion, despite the fact that we were at a cafe called Brioche and eating brioche french toast. Name fail. The bread tasted a few days old and there was nothing special to remember about it.

There were slightly too many capers on the SSS for my taste but if you're into salty balls, you'll probably love it.

Ambiance was cute except for the fact that there were a lot of bugs flying around :-\ I would go back to try the pastries (i.e., almond croissant) but would probably brunch at one of the other quality places in NB -- Cafe Pucini, Grecco, Mama's, Mo's, etc.
author: Nicole W.

description: Had the lamb sandwich. Super yummy, albeit a little mayonnaisey.. the freeway bread is great, and all the sandwiches looked Devine. Will definitely be back to sample more!
author: Jeff M.

description: We special ordered two "Gallettes des Rois" without almond filling (we like the simple traditional plain galettes so we can smother the top in jams). They were fabulously perfect just like I remember as a kid in France. So light and flaky, yet so buttery and flavorful. They were things of beauty and less expensive than the inferior ones from Boulange. "Le Roi boi, Le Roi boi"!
author: Dennis F.

description:
I came here with some friends who wanted to get a light dinner one night in the city.

They got sandwiches while I ordered a small strawberry and almond tart. It was something like $5, and albeit it being pretty tasty, I felt it wasn't worth near that type of money. There are a lot of haute bakeries nearby that price their goods more reasonably than this casual eatery.

I should have just ordered the almond croissant that everyone else here has mentioned.
author: Kenny O.

description: Chicken Pot Pie was delicious. Ordered two glasses of wine with as well. They were both under-poured. One was about 4oz, the other 4.5oz. When I asked why the difference, I got "oh this one, we gave you extra." FML
author: keith g.

description: This place is great. It's in a really convenient location of the intersections of Chinatown, North Beach, and the Financial District, and offers just about everything you could possibly want. From fantastic sandwiches to breakfasts that will knock your socks off Brioche Bakery and Cafe is the tops. I come here on my way to the library and always get a great cup of coffee, or a latte. I would come here a thousand times over. Brioche is a delight.
author: Dan C.

description: This charming little place reminded me of a restaurant my boyfriend and I went to in Paris. I came here with 2 of my girlfriends and wedding dress shopping at Novella. Seems like a have different foods but have some staple pastries, we were quite hungry so we had ordered entrees instead. I ordered the spinach quiche and my friends ordered the croque monsieur and a fresh chicken pot pie. Everything tasted so good! My quiche was light and fluffy with full of flavor and came with a side salad. I would definitely come back if I'm in the area.
author: Linda L.

description: This was a perfect breakfast spot for my last day in SF before heading home. Food was quality, solid coffee, and really nice staff.  I would definitely come back.
author: Carly W.

description: Ended up here because other cafes in that area closed at 6pm. Loved my coffee and the grilled capresse. A must visit!
author: Karthik K.

description:
Compliments in a list:

1. My fellow foodie friend shared a giltcity brunch deal with me. Being a spaz that I am, I accidentally bought the "lunch deal" vs. the "brunch deal." I happen to LOVE brunch and was standing there, holding my wrinkled print-out voucher, absolutely devastated that I made that boo-boo. The owner (I think?) behind the counter probably sensed our distress, looked over and kindly suggested that if we didn't find something we liked, there were other choices as a substitute. My friend jumped on this opportunity to ask if I could possibly (out of the kindness of her heart) let me switch my "lunch" voucher into a "brunch" voucher. The owner claimed that was absolutely fine and said all I had to do was pay the difference of the two deals.

I'm sure a lot of places would be willing to do this given this situation...but it's always the attitude of how one handle things that make the biggest difference. From the way the owners here interacted with us, it tells us: this place cares for their customers. Are very down-to-earth. They're probably one of the classic mom n' pop joints that take joy in people enjoying their food than the profit itself.

2. THE FOOD! I ended up ordering eggs benedict, and it was absolutely scrumptious. Actually, when I ordered the eggs benedict, the owner informed me that they were out of Canadian bacon and asked if it was alright to substitute it with ham or salmon. I picked salmon and she didn't charge extra.

Let me say it again. Down-to-earth. Unpretentious. Makes the food taste even better.

3. THE COFFEE! I'm not even a coffee drinker, but I ordered a Chai Latte and tried some of my friend's Iced Mocha, and both were really good! Probably my favorite Chai Latte I've had so far. Previously, I always claimed that the Chai from Mandeville Coffee Cart in UCSD was the best...but, sorry, no longer. This one was very rich and aromatic, which might not float some boats; but if you're sensitive to sweetness, I'm sure you can take advantage of their kindness and ask them to lower the sugar level for you.

Plus, the coffee's fair trade. Controversial feature, I know, but seeing how they didn't charge extra for the salmon, I'd like to hope for the best.

4. THE PASTRIES are really, really good! I got the Raisin Snail (?) and I actually finished it along with my meal. (Yes, I was a little shocked that I ate that much: giant cup of chai, eggs benedict, and a pastry. I had to walk around Chinatown-Powell afterwards to make myself feel better.)

5. I think the only regret I have was not leaving a tip in the tip jar at the very end. Very uncultured of me, I know. But hopefully someone will listen to my 5-star review. And hopefully I'll find myself around the area in the future, and I'll make up for it then.
author: Jennifer H.

description: I love this place. Their pastries are amazing and the people that work there are so friendly. I'm also a big fan of their French breakfast because their baguettes are delicious and the fruit is fresh and of good quality. I've been to France a few times and this place makes me feel like I'm really there again!
author: Grace P.

description:
Each morning of my trip I tried out a different bakery, trying to find one that could hold a candle to the two bakeries I frequent in Austin (Upper Crust and Quack's).  One of my favorite morning pastries is the almond croissant, and according to other reviewers here, this place was supposed to have yummy almond croissants.  Sad to say, I was pretty disappointed.  

I asked for an almond croissant, heated up, and a coffee. The croissant wasn't heated through by half.  What is that cold, yellow, slimy stuff inside these things?  What a terribly poor excuse for almond paste/marzipan.  At least the coffee was yummy.
author: Deanna T.

description:
I wish this place was closer to my house - way better than the other lunch/pastry shops down Columbus.

Tried the pear salad and it was really good, will definitely be back!
author: Karen S.

description: I love this cute small French cafe. Their Eggs benedicts are so good. I have tried plenty of breakfast plates and the lasagnia and the food is crafted with good indegrediants.   Try the Olive Loaf. My favorite and they run out this loaf often because it is so good.
author: Hector A.

description: Charming and clean little cafe with delicious pastries, fresh breakfast items made to order and great coffee. Well priced with quick and friendly service.
author: Laura J.

description: Excellent pastry and excellent coffee.  If I ever visit San Francisco again, I will go there for sure.  Great customer service also !!
author: Tohru I.

description: Came here for breakfast on a Sunday. Ordered the quiche of the day and the brioche French toast. We were told that the chef never showed up so we couldn't have the French toast...my husband ordered the French breakfast instead. We paid $5 for a side of fruit that consisted of melon - not good at all. The spinach and tomato quiche and my latte were pretty good but everything else was very average.
author: Jillian P.

description: This cafe is ok... I liked the coffee, but you should take that with a grain of salt since i'm not a huge coffee person. We got some of their croissants (chocolate tasted like it wasn't fresh... yet didn't taste exactly stale. Kinda strange). The almond croissant was pretty good but I liked the one from patisserie Philippe better (SO SAD that they changed hands not too long ago). Nothing stood out too much to me, and I'd stop by if I was in the area but I didn't find it as AH-MAH-ZING as other yelpers.
author: Lily C.

description:
Purchased in Walnut Creek, at the FM stand outside of Kaiser.

Wonderful stuff they make! So pleasing to the eye and not to the wallet...I was particularly taken with the large twist of cinnamony goodness. It was pretty stupendous.

The flair of their bakery items (oh yes, there was flair) makes those salivary glands go straight into 4th gear, and my lifelong kryptonite has now been ingested. MMMM MMMM great.
author: Jana C.

description:
Very genteel, classic French bakery and cafe with an emphasis on, you guessed it, brioches and danishes made with brioche dough. Enough butter and egg yokes to choke an artery, but worth it every now and again. 

Besides breakfast baked goods, they have a decent selection of baguette sandwiches and breads for sale. I brought a whole wheat levain home but found it to be a tad on the dry side.

Only a few tables in the cafe but its cozy, clean and comfortable.
author: David P.

description: Legit breakfast spot. Every bite I took was super fresh. I had the avocado scramble with chicken sausage. Amazing chai lattes too. Sit at a table outside facing towards downtown and you have one of the best views of the city. Far enough below north beach where you avoid all the tourist foot traffic and can eat outside in peace. I'm excited to come back for lunch.
author: Sean K.

description:
What a great find!

Awesome Chai Latte (best I've ever had), tasty muffins, pastries, quiche, etc.

Really friendly service.

Top notch quality all around.
author: Miguel S.

description: Our breakfasts here were very fresh and delicious.  We had French toast and quiche and both dishes were very fresh and good. My husband had a side of bacon which was very overdone and dried out, but that was the only poor quality food we ate.  My pet peeve is thinly sliced and soggy French toast, but their French toast was thick and had just the right amount of crunch around the edges!
author: Sarah R.

description: I came here last night after a hard day of work to relax. It's a perfect cute little cafe for me to finish the day. I had pumpkin pie and a cup of chai. The staff recognized me from previous visits and since it was a little slow had time to come out and talk. Of course I'll be back plenty of times. I have to recommend it! See you again soon Brioche!
author: Marcus L.

description: I happened to stumble upon this place today and what a lovely surprise!  The pastry case called me in, everything looked so good.  Super fresh super luxe.  I opted for the quiche and fruit salad.  The quiche was unreal, the best, great crust, great texture, super filling.  The fruit was very fresh too.  I can't wait to go back, I must try the various sweets.  The brownie looked unreal!
author: La C.

description:
So nice we dined here twice! In a city with so many delicious options to choose from, that's unheard of!

Granola made in-house and piled high with fresh strawberries, blackberries, blueberries, and raspberries (!!!) satisfied my need for a healthy, gluten-free breakfast, while my husband's French Breakfast gave me the chance to indulge myself in a few bites of crusty, chewy, bready goodness (followed quickly by some antacids to save myself the future pain).

Brioche, I miss you already! Please mail me a loaf of bread!
author: Alicia J.

description: Very nice staff, nice lattes and authentic pastries ( so says my French mother in law, who will not say that about many places). One star removed b/c my MIL didn't think the brioche was super authentic--no top. Bit tasty!
author: Meredith O.

description:
I walk by this place daily on my way to work. The awning looks cute from a cross the street..but I've never stopped in because I am always in a rush.
This morning I decided to trek across the street and check it out. 
I almost got the brioche but opted for the olive fugasse..it was excellent! I ate half for breakie and am saving half to eat with my lunch. The folks working there were super nice! I believe that it is an independently owned business and I am happy to support them from now on!
author: Mimi T.

description: Amazing food, we had two pastres, a breakfast crastant with fruit, and a bowl of French onion soup. Everything was Amazing. Coffee was good, strawberry lemonade was good also. The only reason it wasn't 5 stars was it wasn't bussed well. There wasn't any wait staff per say. You had to get your own drinks and clean the tables. Other than that fantastic food. Quiet place, cozy, and enjoyable.
author: Cory M.

description:
Can't pretend to know too much about french pastries, but I can say this: THE BRIOCHE IS BOMB
THE PLACE IS ADORABLE
THE WORKERS WERE HELPFUL AND SPOKE FRENCH
:)
author: Cindy C.

description: We found this bakery just around the corner of our hotel on Broadway and visited this place for 3 days out of our 6 day stay in SF for breakfast. Friendly staff and an excellent variety of breakfast choices.
author: Robert K.

description: This review is only based on what we got, 4 small cakes : 2 triple chocolate mousses , lava cake and chocolate raspberry cake.  I might be picky because I am French but not good at all.  I took two bites of mine and decided it was not worth the calories.
author: Sandrine D.

description: Adorable little European-style coffee cafe. The pastries look wonderful but I didn't try any. The best part about this place is they know how to make a real espresso with a proper crema on top.
author: Rose Mary i.

description: I always have to stop by this place when in SF everyday if I can, starwberry lemonade is a MUST, their tomatoes are fresh and amazing, everything there is GREAT.
author: Hank B.

description: Cute decor, clean space, friendly people, and the sandwiches are super good. I had the Grilled Vegetable Hot Panini, the bread was lightly toasted and every sandwich bite was oozing mozzarella. I also love that it was not crowded and quiet enough to enjoy my lunch and catch up on some emails. Next time I'm in San Francisco, I'll definitely be here for brunch.
author: Stef R.

description: Croissants da bomb.. I have tried butter, ham and cheese, almond and chocolate several times!
author: P D.

description: The service is friendly, the food is tasty.  A bit warm inside, but other than that awesome for brunch. Would def come back here!
author: Christian E.

description: Had the eggs Benedict with a salad and a chocolate mousse. Everything was wonderfully fresh and flavorful. The mint iced tea was a nice surprise. Great place for a light, refreshing meal.
author: Kim K.

description:
OVERALL:4.4   FOOD:4.5   SERVICE:4   AMBIANCE:5   VALUE:4

It's the end of March, it's 77 degrees (30 degrees above my hometown!), it's sunny, and I have the day off -- Qu'on mange de la brioche!

A little piece of springtime in Paris (with some Moroccan flair), this spot is ideal for:
  (1) people-watching (lots of sharp FiDi suits & skirts...oh là là!).
  (2) enjoying pastries with unadvisably high butter content
        (croissants, briwats, and pain aux raisins, oh my!).
  (3) getting your vitamin D on while sipping du café outside.
  (4) surfing the Google on free Interwebs.
  (5) generally living up la vie en rose.

Bon appétit!
author: Amy K.

description: Friendly staff, great food and coffee, good people watching and available wifi.  Good for Sunday afternoons.
author: Jill S.

description: Avocado egg scramble is a satisfying breakfast. The chocolate croissants are divine. Fresh squeezed OJ too.
author: Debra M.

description: My new favorite SF bakery. Their sweet brioche did not disappoint and was actually the primary reason for my conversion. If you like brioche and you've had the real thing in France, it's a must try. The chocolate lava cake is also sinfully delicious; I only wish it came with a raspberry coolie. Clearly that hasn't deterred me from eating it, just a recommendation :)
author: Caroll M.

description: 4 stars since I've only been here once so far and only got a blueberry tart. The tart was really good, with fresh and plump blueberries, but I've had a bigger one with a variety of berries on top for the same price ($4). I looked around and everything looks pretty good! They have a variety of pastries and cookies, and a small selection of desserts. Brioche looks like such a cozy place -- I can't wait to come back and try some of their real food!
author: Rose Y.

description:
The proscuitto, pear, and avocado sandwich here is fantastic.

The croissants are also good.  I like their chocolate croissant.
author: Niniane W.

description: Croque monsieur and a steak kale coup. Hearty!
author: Maximillian M.

description:
On a dire search for good coffee and no Starbucks in sight my friend and I came upon this place. 

Not only was the coffee good, but the almond croissant was amazing. 

Came back here for breakfast the next day and ordered the eggs Benedict with potatoes. Every bite was soo yummy! 

The place is quaint and very cute. Plus there is a great bookstore across the street that is also worth checking out. 

If I could, I would fly here every morning just to have breakfast.
author: Jenna S.

description:
Small, quaint, adorable and cute this place will steal your heart at the get gof.  It reminds me of a little Parisian cafe that's warm, welcoming and full of charm.  The pastries are SOOOO GOOOOD and I love the brioche, which is what they are named for.

  The coffee is decadent and strong and the environment invites long hours of reading and contemplating while you sip your drink and eat your pastry.

  A definite must for an hour of relaxation and to settle that sweet craving you had all day.
author: Anthony N.

description:
At the advice of other Yelpers, I went for the almond croissant. Not the best I've ever had, but still very good.

My only complaints are that the table I sat at was a bit dirty, and my glass of milk had a few small hairs on the rim - gross. Maybe their dishwasher was broken that day or something.

Slightly better-than-average prices for the city, decent service, decent food... overall decent cafe :)
author: Amanda O.

description: Friendly service, tasty coffee, delicate, but hearty portioned sugar brioche and delicious fruit danish filled us up for $10.  Loved this peaceful Sunday morning outing with our dogs.
author: Esther R.

description: Lovely little place with super friendly staff. The food is really very good and they seem to always be preparing more with lovely hot fresh baked goods being brought out from the kitchen regularly.
author: John B.

description: Came here in the morning a few months ago, the server woman behind the counter took an order from a guy who was behind me in line, didn't ask "who's next ", I didn't appreciate that.  There were only 2 of us standing there so it wasn't busy.  For a French themed cafe they were playing some Spanish music.  The food was pretty good.  Seems like the owner may need to re-educate their morning manager. 1 star for rude, 3 stars for food.
author: BRIAN F.

description: My only experience with Brioche Bakery is at the San Mateo Farmers Market every Saturday.  They have a huge booth set up with pastries and bread.  I head for the pastries.  Mmmmm.  Their prices are a little on the high side.  But this is my sugar fix and I need it man!  So far I've tasted their bread pudding, chocolate croissants, flan, sugar roll and eclair.  I'm bad I'm telling you.  It is all good, but it is not super sweet tasting like frosting from Costco.  It is a light sugar I can't describe it.  But this is one of my happy places I like to visit once a week.
author: Michelle M.

description:
Great chicken sandwich. Mozzarella is ok as well. The salad dressing is a bit too sweet for my taste and the salad didn't look that fresh. Overall nice place with many options.
Open on the weekend is a plus in the neighborhood.
author: Michela G.

description: just had a very tasty almond croissant. One of the best in a long while. I'm glad my co-worker introduced me to this bakery and next time I come back I'll try others pastries... it just hit the spot..
author: Charles S.

description:
I think I've passed by here a million times but never had the chance to come here since I usually go home late and this place closes at 6pm. I finally got up at 8am in the morning just so I can come here! 

My friend Alex wanted to come here also but never had the chance so I met him up this morning for coffee. We had a nice morning walk to the Brioche Bakery. When we walked in I can smell the fresh bread aroma. Boy I was hungry! Before coming here I read about all the wonderful reviews about their almond croissant. So I aimed for that, a cup of vanilla soy latte, and a brioche to-go. My friend Alex had the ham and cheese croissant and a BIG cup of vanilla soy latte as well. 

CASH ONLY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

 We enjoyed our cup of joe along with our "breakfast" here. The seating area is kind of small but very nice and quiet so we got some catching up done. I actually never had an almond croissant before since I'm not really a big fan of almond flavor deedees but I'm glad my friend talked me into trying it. It was actually SO good I wanted to order another one but I was so full I couldn't. Plus I already got a brioche to-go anyways. I tried a little bit of Alex's ham and cheese and that was really good as well. The coffee was pretty good but not Tully's good. I really liked their foam though. It was actually THICK not like other poppable ones. 

I'll definitely come back here to hang out with a few friends over coffee and their delicious ALMOND CROISSANT. Highly highly recommend the ALMOND CROISSANT. (I still haven't tried the brioche yet)
author: Tracy A.

description: I've been to Brioche Bakery twice, both times the food impressed. The eggs benedict and the quiche were great. Will definitely be back.
author: Chris V.

description: I have been here a few times now. I had given up all sweets for lent.   Now unfortunately i am slipping right back into them. Alas, they are fantastic here..The pastries are well worth the calories.                  Wonderful coffees and Teas. Salads and sandwiches. Everything is very fresh!   Right near the Little Italy and China town divide. Beautiful little shop full of Charm and you may sit inside or outside.
author: Teresa S.

description: I come here for my local chocolate chip cookie fix.  So far it's the best option in the neighborhood.  Priced at $1.75, its a fair deal, unlike those touristy spots a few blocks away.
author: kyle j.

description: Stopped here on the way home, and tried the creme brûlée which had a great texture and taste, and a cinnamon twist croissant, which was also delicious. We also got a latte which was good. I have not tried any of their sandwiches, but based on their baked goods I can't complain.
author: Misha Z.

description:
I come here after my workouts, since APEXWellness right below the Broiche.  I get my avacado scramble as my recovery for breakfast.  Their croisants are son sinful. 
They also have this chicken pot pie which i treat myself to occassionally.  It's a bit pricey but again, it's North Beach.

 Staff is friendly.
author: Dan G.

description: One of the best vegetarian sandwiches i have had! The  lady at the counter was so incredibly sweet and had the patience to explain what sauces contained eggs and what was purely vegetarian.  The ambience and the food was simply delughtful!
author: Ps N.

description: Great tuna sandwich-- probably the best I've ever had, but pricey. It cost about $9 for a tuna sandwich and a side salad. Yes, some would say that's the price you pay for good food especially in the city, but I don't think I could make a habit of it. On the bright side, the atmosphere was great and the room was very well lit. I liked the cleanliness of the small dining area; it's just that the space would be too small for large parties of 6 or more, especially on a busy day. I've definitely had some great finds for French food in the city & this is one of them. I don't think I would come here often unless I took public transportation (paid $3/h at a nearby meter to park my car!). I would also be conscientious of the pricing bc they don't label the price of the sandwiches in the case, but the staff is nice enough to tell you if you ask. All in all, this was a good place for decent French food & would agree with most of the yelpers on the rating.
author: Brittany D.

description: My wife and I went here the day after Valentine's day. Their food is tasty, the chai is delicious, and the cappuccino has cream so thick you can float a quarter on it. That being said, the service was almost unbearably slow as it took 45 minutes for them to get some eggs and French toast out.
author: Phillip F.

description:
I had a strange baking experience once with a brioche.  The recipe called for them to be stuffed with pistachio custard and when I pulled out the rack of steaming hot piping baked goods, they deflated within the hour of cooling, and I was left crying like a maid over spilt milk.

I paid a visit here with a friend visiting from Seattle every single day of his business stay.....the brioches here are amazing.  Soft and lightly brown on the outside, tear it in half and it reveals a wonderfully cream center of fresh buttery textures.  It literally melted in my mouth.  We were both pretty generic and always went for the plain brioche, smear it with butter while still warm, and with some strawberry preserves, absolute Elysium.
author: Miika M.

description:
This place is excellent - they stock some of the best bread I've found in SF cafes, and they offer very fresh and well-portioned sandwiches.  Their coffee is pretty good, and they also offer quality salads.  I've only had a burger here once, but it was properly medium-rare and quite tasty.  In addition to the good food, the staff are very sociable and pleasant.

I've seen a few complaints, which seem to be either unreasonable or just unfortunate exceptions to the norm.  As far as the sandwiches not being sliced...is that really a big deal?  If it wasn't cut, all you'd need to do is ask, it's a simple fix.  And, as far as pricing goes, it's right in line with other places in the area.

The pastries are supposed to be great, although I've never tried any.
author: Seamus R.

description:
Mmmm, Brioche. This little gem is a block from my office, my co-workers and I are in here all the time.

Their espresso drinks are always made perfectly, their pastries divine.
They have an awesome breakfast selection, from filling benedicts to a light 'french breakfast.' 

For lunch they have salads, cold sandwiches and paninis. They have a ready made selection for when you're in a hurry, it's a life saver during working lunches.

I've also had them cater lunch at our office.  They were helpful, professional and catered a perfect meal for 15 people with less then 24 hours notice. 

Brioche is my go to cafe, they know what they're doing and they do it well.
author: Tara T.

description:
New owners since May 09 and now there is consistentcy to the lineup of the Sweets.

Get the Lava cake and eat it there; ask for it to be heated UP =)
It's a chocolate cake with a portion of dark chocolate in the center that gets' liquidy hot when the cake is heated in the oven. It is deeply satisfying.
author: Bert K.

description:
Reading my TMI first yelp, you can say I made it back for #3. And there were three parts to it:

3.1: What a rocking panini. You know when turkey and tomato and bread come together and form kind of a gooey almost cheese like but there is no cheese in it kind of flavor? That's what it was like. Guy making it was super friendly and accommodating the whole time dealing with my little customizing requests.

3.2: Granola is house made, and they gave me a massive portion on the side for a few bucks less than a full on parfait.

3.3: Chocolate hazelnut cookie. Bomb.

#4 can be the number of stars. Great spot.
author: Jason B.

description:
Olive Fougasse, brioche & all their baguettes are pretty good. All the pastries are very tasty. 

We used to buy from them at the San Mateo & Daly City/Serramonte farmers market but there are lots of bees munching on their pastries & their stand. No more Brioche  Bakery at the Farmers Markets for us.
author: Marwan T.

description:
Love this place!!! 
Every morning me and my friends sat down for a nice cup of coffee and a croissant or croque monsieur. Everything is so fresh! 
I had a croque monsieur one morning which was great. You can also order a croissant with jam if you are not that hungry. You can sit as long as you like, take another refill or two and enjoy the place and enjoy watching the people that come in.
author: Floor R.

description: I love their bake goods and food is excellent as well plus the owners are super sweet! but just too bad that their recent hires are not as friendly :(
author: Karla D.

description: Pretty good coffee shop and bakery with all the usual items. A bit on the pricey side but the food and drinks were all excellent. Word of warning to the early risers - the full menu with french toast isn't open until 9am on sat/sun.
author: Robert B.

description:
During my stay in the North Hotel in San Francisco where breakfast wasn't available we had to find a place to have breakfast during our three nights stay. Luckily across the street we found this cosy spot. 

It has the best breakfast: brioche, croque monsieur, sandwiches, cereals with yoghurt and fruit, muffins, other delicious pastries, fresh orange juice and more! Everything you can wish for before starting a long day of shopping or (as we did) biking in SF. 
You can decide for yourself how expensive you'll make it: if you don't have that much to spend you can just take a croissant with cheese and a coffee, a croque monsieur and a fresh oranje juice costed me 13 dollars so that was a bit more expensive. However: one of the best croque monsieurs i'd ever had so pretty much worth it!:)

Two notes:
You cannot miss the mustache of the waiter.

The place has free wifi, so while enjoying a cup of coffee you can also do some research on what to do that day in SF or maybe do some work.
author: Esther Z.

description:
The staff is very friendly.. It has limited seating inside; but there are places to sit outside, too.  I haven't tried non-sweet items; but these are my thoughts on the sweet stuff:

- Gelato:  I assumed that because of its location, the gelato would be good.  Ahem.. no.  I only ate about 2/3 of my chocolate gelato and I had to dump the rest.  I prefer Ciao Bella gelato.
- Triple chocolate cake:  Ok.. not a fan of the light chocolate and the texture.
- Lava cake:  It was really dense, but it was chocolaty which I looove.

I'll have to try the sandwiches/tartines to have a more well-rounded review.
author: Doreen M.

description:
I decided to visit this spot for the only fact that I wanted to find some really good Brioche bread.  I was pleasantly surprised that this little spot is a gem!  I had a mocha (delicious!) and a croissant (divine).  It was too cold to sit outside, but inside was just fine.  My only complaint, I wish there was more seating, but then again, it would not be so quaint!

I will be going back to sample other goodies and buy that loaf of Brioche bread!

A great spot to sit with friends and have good food, and good conversation, while enjoying the sights and sounds of North Beach!
author: Shannon S.

description:
A must-stop-by stand at the Friday Oakland FM.  I get my fix of olive fougasse, ham & cheese croisssant, and a baguette.  And as I walk away I'm already counting down til next Friday... 
Noticed a new item today - German pretzel... soooo fresh and soft and yummy.
author: Alina C.

description: I loved this cute little Frenchie bakery that N led us to. N has spent time in France and she loved the croissant and omelet. Coffees were authentically European and decidedly uncorporate. There are cozy tables inside and patio seating as well. A regular who lives nearby told us that she comes here for breakfast all the time. It definitely seemed like the perfect place to enjoy a casual weekend brunch or afternoon snack.
author: Cathy C.

description:
I always walk by this place on my way to work, so the other day I thought, "hey, why not?" 

I wish I would have spent my money elsewhere. 

First of all, I walked in and was not once greeted. I walk up to the register where a blank face just stared at me until I finally said something. She then says harshly, "what do you want?" I should have just left then, but I figured she was just having a bad morning. I order a spinach and Gruyere omelette and a latte. I was giving a number and sat down. 

My latte was promptly brought out to me and it was pretty good. I thought this was a good sign that my food would be just as good.

I was wrong. 

After waiting 30+ minutes for my simple omelette (I was the only person in the shop), already having finished my latte and finally given a glass of water, I was ready to eat. My omelette was unsalted, unflavorful, and downright disgusting. There was a whole sprig of rosemary in my omelette, but this was literally just the stem and nothing else. My toast was obscenely dry, no amount of butter could have helped that toast. Finally, my strawberry had an bird feather stuck to it. I wanted to complain and get my money back, but at this point I was so fed up I just left without saying anything.

Looking back I wish I would have gotten my money back. Going to this establishment was a mistake and I will never return.
author: Barrett C.

description: Cool spot. Really chill area. :)
author: Amanda B.

description: Best Eggs Benedict! Tip: not on the menu, but if you ask for it, you can get Salmon Benedict-highly recommended! Very friendly staff.
author: Gene G.

description:
Speaking of addicted, I love the olive bread!  And the cheddar jalepeno loaf.  And the small tarts (try the almond).  And speaking of almond, their almond croissant is much richer than others I've had - so sweet and delicious and full of almondy goodness.  For a unique treat, try their quiche - it has a brioche crust!  Everything is good here, including the service, which is comfy and warm, like the decor.  I could eat bread every day... mmmmm.

And today I had the endive salad.  Superb.  Endive leaves, stuffed with apples, blue cheese, caramelized walnuts and dressed with balsamic vinaigrette.  A healthy breakfast or light lunch.
author: Sondra H.

description:
Ah, the yelp dilemna.  Exposing your local favorite spots and increasing the crowd potential.  

Sorry Brioche, you are just too good to keep to myself.  Unfortunately, they took the breakfast burrito off the menu.  I never had the chance to test it out, but I heard some rumors of 'best breakfast burrito I've ever had' floating around.  Fortunately for the rest of the world, they do have the best french toast that I've ever had.  You guessed it, made with brioche.  You also guessed it, fresh berry coulis with strawberries/blueberries/raspberries littered on top of it.  When I have this for brunch, I can't eat until dinner time.  I wouldn't want to either.  

I have never been disappointed with anything here.  I don't really drink mochas much, but when I do, I make sure its a Brioche mocha.

Obviously, the pastries/bread/French style sandwiches are top notch as well.  This place rocks.  Just don't come before I get in line, I don't like to wait.  Lookout: only serve the prime time breakfast options on weekends.
author: William B.

description:
Ok so this review is just for the dude with the awesome moosestache.  I think I love you?

You make delicious pastries, have facial hair to be envied, and you play a giant bass.  What more could a girl ask for?
author: Chelsea C.

description:
Good selection of baked goods, including, of course, several types of brioches; savories; breads. Decent Americano, tho I prefer the one at SBUX.  Yes SBUX.
Tip..Go in the morning, for a better selection.
author: Séamus C.

description:
We visited for brunch last weekend, sat outside and enjoyed a nice meal.
We each ordered different coffees and were pretty happy with the preparation.  We had the following:
Avocado scramble w/ lamb sausage- very good
Smoked salmon tartine- very good
French toast- excellent

Service was fine and when in the neighborhood we'd definitely return.
author: Lizete S.

description: Love, love, love this place! Some of the freshest, most delicious food I have had in the city.  The food, vegetables and pastries are all top notch.  Highly recommended!
author: Yaji T.

description: My three stars could be someone's 4 or 5 stars. It is a good place with good service. Coffee is good and food is even though nothing fancy, but basic good food.
author: Dave T.

description:
There are some really good cafes in North Beach but is the best one a French one?  Say it ain't so. Well, maybe, just maybe.  

I have a weak spot for croissants and they probably have the best one I've ever had. So on a whim I bought a latte and it was bomb. I rarely buy coffee due to weird personal reasons but I would seriously consider buying coffee from here on a regular basis.
author: Roger H.

description:
